text: one of the things that that you've

sharing information around the globe and
so in terms of think about where we are
today with with even understanding
what's going on I wonder if you could
you could just show us a tool that you
have with it with with the council and
what's being done there yeah this is
something that we developed at the
Council on Foreign Relations it's
totally open source and you can embed
this in your website we encourage you to
do so and if you do it will every week
be updated automatically on any website
in the world what we tried to do was
start tracking outbreaks of
vaccine-preventable diseases the key the
big ones like measles and pertussis
polio and so on so if we what we did was
we started inputting data back in two
thousand eight and if you look at the
world in 2008 you actually don't see
very many outbreaks of these classic
vaccine-preventable diseases and most of
them are either in the countries that
were the most affected by propaganda put
out by a gentleman named andrew
wakefield in the UK who claimed that you
got autism from certain vaccines and so
you see these huge circles of outbreaks
mostly in the UK area all related to
families declining to let their children
be vaccinated under the false premise
that they were protecting them from
autism well if you go now forward in
time so let's go out to 2012 all the way
to the end and have the cumulative
picture if we could not just the
outbreaks for that year but all okay
there we go now first of all you see
there's a whole lot more vaccine

but look at the difference what what is

USA and this is all families declining
to vaccinate and almost all these
outbreaks are in wealthy commune
these pockets of upper middle class
wealth in the United States then it
spreads from there whereas if you go
over into the poor world such as Africa
what you're looking at predominantly is
measles and secondarily some whooping
cough and other diseases and here it's
really about the supply chain the
logistics difficulties in delivering
vaccine on a regular schedule getting
the boosters to the right children and
now the one we're really worried about
is if you go all the way over to India
and Pakistan the real concern now is
that we're down to the last one percent
annually of polio cases left in the

is that this is the part of the world
where polio is stuck and it's Pakistan
and Afghanistan and it takes us to
another political dynamic that we have
